pageContext.claim: “All of those millions of people with 401(k)s and pensions are doing far better than they have ever done before with increases of 60, 70, 80, 90 and even 100 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: The Standard & Poor's 500 Index— the broadest measure of the U.S. stock market — was up 47.6 percent from Trump’s inauguration through Monday’s close. Stocks went up higher under Obama in the same time period. Trump often boasts that the value of 401(k) retirement accounts has skyrocketed during his presidency, even though there’s no evidence of such huge gains and even though the Census Bureau reports only 32 percent of Americans are saving for retirement with such plans. An analysis by Fidelity Investments showed the average 401(k) balance increased less than 1 percent when comparing the first quarters of 2018 and 2019.
